intro: Broughtonia pilosa, commonly known as the woolly pineapple plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Broughtonia pilosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique look and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
